title: No room for fossil fuel executives at climate negotiation tables
description: Until their actions align with their words, we should not work with them.

title: Fox News sued by man at centre of Jan 6 conspiracy theory
description: The latest lawsuit against the US conservative media giant follows a $787m settlement with a voting machine company.

title: Deforestation in Colombia dropped by 29 percent, a milestone
description: Deforestation in the Amazon has dropped in both Brazil and Colombia as elected leaders pledge to prioritise environment.

title: Oceans are changing colour and climate change may be to blame
description: Scientists say they have detected shifts in colours across more than half of the world's oceans.

title: IMF approves much-awaited $3bn bailout for Pakistan
description: IMF approves release of funds over nine months to support Pakistan's economic stabilisation programme.

title: Huw Edwards named as BBC presenter in explicit photo scandal
description: Edwards's wife says her husband is suffering from mental health issues as police conclude no crime was committed.

title: What influence does Iran have in Africa?
description: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi is on a three-country African tour, hoping to forge new alliances.

title: Roadside bombings in Mexico kill six people in ‘act of terror’
description: Jalisco Governor Enrique Alfaro blames drug-trafficking groups for placing explosives as a 'trap' for police officers.

title: Black refugees remain trapped along border between Tunisia, Libya
description: Tunisia claims to have evacuated groups of refugees it had expelled to its border, but many remain.

title: Ons Jabeur progresses to Wimbledon semifinals
description: The Tunisian came back from a set down and finished the match 6-7 (5), 6-4, 6-1 against 2022 winner Elena Rybakina.

title: In northern Syria, displaced blame Russia for end to vital aid
description: UN Security Council unable to agree on extension to cross-border aid to opposition areas, which expired on Monday.

title: NATO didn’t ‘create incentive’ for Putin to stop Ukraine war
description: As the NATO summit in Lithuania wraps up, analysts say its declaration has fallen short and dashed Kyiv’s hopes.

title: Analysis: Ukraine rolls back 6 months of Russian gains in 5 weeks
description: Assessment of Ukraine’s counteroffensive suggests it has retaken 253sq km (98sq miles) of its territory since June.

title: Microsoft says China-linked hackers accessed government emails
description: China rejects allegations that its hackers targeted Western accounts, accusing the US of spreading 'disinformation'.

title: Stellar birth: Webb Space Telescope captures baby star close-up
description: Telescope, used to study the formation of the first stars and galaxies. marks its first anniversary with a new image.

title: Mitsotakis, Erdogan hail ‘positive climate’ in Greece-Turkey ties
description: After decades of dispute over energy resources, the two recently re-elected leaders agreed to a positive climate.

title: Palestinian leader Abbas visits Jenin camp after Israeli raid
description: President visits days after mourners' anger forces three of his senior officials to leave a funeral for those killed.

title: Bank of Canada hikes interest rates to 22-year high
description: The second increase in as many months came on the back of persistent inflation and excess consumer spending.

title: Israeli fire wounds reported Hezbollah members on Lebanon border
description: The wounded were taken to hospital near the scene of the explosion in Lebanon's southern province of Bustan.

title: How does a country join NATO?
description: World’s most powerful military alliance has 31 members. Sweden is poised to make it 32, and Ukraine wants in as well.

title: Settler faces ‘terrorism’ charges over West Bank mosque vandalism
description: Israelis are rarely punished for crimes committed against Palestinians, particularly in the occupied West Bank.

title: Surovikin: Russian general missing since Wagner mutiny ‘resting’
description: Surovikin was last seen in a video urging Wagner Group fighters to halt their mutiny last month.

title: EU Parliament passes law to restore degraded natural ecosystems
description: The new law will require EU countries to introduce measures restoring nature on a fifth of their land and sea by 2030.

title: Kenyan police tear-gas protesters in latest row over tax hikes
description: Rallies, the second in a week, held after bill raising taxes in highly indebted Kenya signed into law by President Ruto.

title: ‘Very dangerous’: Russia slams G7 security assurances to Ukraine
description: G7 countries have announced security assurances to Ukraine to deter future Russian attacks, a move decried by Moscow.

title: Fighters kill four soldiers at southern Pakistani army base
description: Five soldiers were critically wounded and at least three attackers were killed, the army said.

title: Saving Brazil’s Democracy
description: We investigate the forces threatening Brazil's democratic institutions and the Lula government’s agenda.

title: ‘Like a jailhouse’: Afghans languish in US detention centres
description: Fleeing deteriorating conditions under the Taliban, some Afghan refugees have made a risky trek to the US-Mexico border.

title: Rewriting Libraries: Challenging the past in Kenya
description: Turning the page on the past by transforming colonial public libraries in Nairobi.

title: Costlier cars? Why China’s gallium, germanium export curbs matter
description: Beijing's latest salvo in a chip war with Washington could affect everything from electric vehicles to smartphones.

title: Bulgari apologises to China after Taiwan listing sparks fury
description: The brand is the latest global firm to bend to sensitivities in China, a giant luxury market.

title: Analysis: The war in Sudan is a problem for Egypt
description: Egypt is keen to protect itself as Sudan's military strongmen wage war.

title: More Sudanese flee the fighting, UK sanctions warring factions
description: The sanctions target three businesses linked with the army and three others tied to the RSF.

title: South Africa police launch manhunt after six die in mass shooting
description: Three men enter the yard of a home and open fire in the Eastern Cape province township of KwaNobuhle.

title: Toxic tuna? Hong Kong may ban Japan seafood over Fukushima water
description: Tokyo insists its plans to discharge the treated water from the tsunami-wrecked nuclear plant are safe.

title: UN body’s motion on Quran burning: How did your country vote?
description: The motion brought after the Muslim holy book was desecrated in Sweden was disputed, but passed.

title: The Netherlands takes steps to prosecute crimes against Yazidis
description: Yazidi community hails 'the beginning of our path to justice' as a Dutch citizen faces jail for enslaving Yazidi woman.

title: Milan Kundera, The Unbearable Lightness of Being author, dies
description: Kundera, who moved to France in 1975, was one of Czechoslovakia's best-known writers.

title: Iran’s Raisi begins Africa trip, signs agreements with Kenya
description: Iran has recently stepped up diplomatic outreach to developing countries, with trips to Latin America and now Africa.

title: Thai foreign minister met Aung San Suu Kyi on secret Myanmar trip
description: Don Pramudwinai tells ASEAN foreign ministers he met jailed elected leader as well as coup leader Min Aung Hlaing.

title: Iran summons Russian envoy over statement with GCC on islands
description: Like China did in December, Russia has signed a statement with the GCC, challenging Iran's ownership of three islands.

title: Frontex: When great power comes with no responsibility
description: Is the European Union border security agency really using its immense powers 'responsibly'?

title: Egypt says it’s selling $1.9bn in assets in privatisation push
description: The government is selling stakes in 32 state companies as Egypt continues to grapple with an economic crisis.

title: Protests continue in Israel against proposed judicial changes
description: Anti-proposal activists demonstrated nationwide all day, including at mass protest at Ben Gurion International Airport.

title: China promises ‘robust response’ to any NATO expansion in Asia
description: Beijing rejects NATO concern over its 'stated ambitions', criticises presence of four Asian countries at Vilnius summit.

title: Philippines allows Barbie film with blurred South China Sea map
description: Censors want a 'cartoonish map' depicting China's claim over the South China Sea blurred from the film.

title: China launches world’s first methane-fuelled space rocket
description: Success of Zhuque-2 puts China ahead of US firms SpaceX and Blue Origin in developing methane-fuelled space rockets.

title: ‘My home’: The Mozambican electrician who moved to Zimbabwe twice
description: After fleeing war in Mozambique and then economic peril in Zimbabwe, Luciano Chataika has found a home away from home.

title: Why is solitary confinement in US prisons so routine?
description: Tens of thousands of people are held in protracted isolation with dire implications for their health, rights groups say.

title: Full text: NATO Vilnius summit communique
description: NATO leaders are meeting in the Lithuanian capital against the backdrop of Russia's continuing invasion of Ukraine.

title: Thai court to decide on case seeking Pita’s disqualification
description: Move comes a day before the parliament votes on Pita Limjaroenrat's bid to become the next prime minister of Thailand.

title: Ukraine F-16 fighter pilot training to start soon in Romania
description: Ukraine defence minister says he hopes training lasts no longer than 6 months so planes in combat against Russia soon.

title: Sri Lanka’s fishermen face double whammy of climate and economy
description: Small-scale fishers who supply nearly half of Sri Lanka’s animal protein are being hit by inflation and climate change.

title: Belarus artist who put manure at Lukashenko’s office dies in jail
description: Artist and political activist Ales Pushkin, 57, has died in a prison in what his wife said were 'unclear circumstances'.

title: Taiwan says Chinese air force, navy stage mass drill near island
description: Defence ministry says monitoring the situation after Chinese air force planes appeared to be coordinating with ships.

title: North Korea fires ‘unidentified’ ballistic missile: South Korea
description: The launch comes after Pyongyang condemned US over nuclear submarine and threatened to shoot down spy planes.

title: Russia’s Medvedev says NATO’s Ukraine aid brings world war closer
description: The deputy secretary of Russia's Security Council said Western military aid would not stop Moscow's victory in Ukraine.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 504
description: As the conflict enters its 504th day, these are the main developments.

title: Japan turns to livestreamed fish in Fukushima safety campaign
description: Tokyo has embarked on a multi-million dollar campaign to convince people it's safe to release radioactive water.

title: US Justice Dept switches course on Trump immunity in Carroll case
description: The department previously said Trump enjoyed immunity for comments that writer E Jean Carroll called defamatory.
